utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m thinking about growing a goatee.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, actually that’s a Van Dyke. A goatee is just hair on the chin.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Wait, then what is it if you just have hair up here?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You mean a moo-stache?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Moo-stache.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He said it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ha-ha, very funny. Make fun of the foreign guy. For your information, there are four times as many Indians as there are Americans, so the way we say it is right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Say what?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Moo-stache.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Moo-stache.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He said it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Guys, you’re being childish.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s right. You’re grown men, the kind who are perfectly capable of growing your own moo-staches.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hey, you were funny on purpose, good job.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. Sorry I’m late, I was at an audition.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’ll get ’em next time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How about instead of assuming I failed, you ask me how it went?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry. How did it go?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Just shut up.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Here, you can have your seat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, no, stay there. I’m fine on the floor.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Have you guys ever thought about getting a dining room table?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah. You actually do have room for one up there.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, sure, I sit on the floor for years, no one cares. The pretty white girl’s there ten seconds, and suddenly we’re all running to IKEA.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No one is running anywhere. We’re not getting a dining room table.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know you don’t like change, but it’s not a terrible idea.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, you guys never use that space up there. Why not get a table?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you want the long answer or the short answer?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, how come we never get that option?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Chaos theory suggests that even in a deterministic system, if the equations describing its behaviour are non-linear, a tiny change in the initial conditions can lead to a cataclysmic and unpredictable result.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Translation?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Waah. I don’t want a table.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Penny and I are gonna go shop for a dining room table. You want to come with us?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, I’d love to, but, um, I’m too busy falling back in love with Windows 98.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Seriously? You haven’t used this desk in years. The second I want to get rid of it, you’re up here working?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t talk right now, I have several thousand updates to install.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you really gonna sit here all day?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Think of me as Arthur Dent in Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy, lying in front of the bulldozers to protect his home.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If you’ll recall, the Vogon fleet blew up the Earth anyway.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a made-up story, Leonard, I don’t even know why you’re talking about it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m putting all this stuff in storage. We don’t need any of it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You, how can you say that? You show me one thing in here we can live without.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hang on. Check your in-box.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. Is this really worth it? We’ve lived together for years with nary an argument.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But we start talking about a table, and suddenly we’re at each other’s throats.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nary an argument? Nary?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that means not one, or not any. Maybe instead of a table, you should buy a dictionary. Well, I don’t know if I won that, but at least he’s upset.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Check it out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Magic wand TV remote?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I can control all sorts of stuff.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Did Bernadette think it was cool?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not when I said mute and pointed it at her face.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, uh, let me try. Uh, channelis changeroni. This might be my second favorite brown magic wand.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, that’s the last time I play with that. I have to take this. Hello? 00:04:24,137

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, off. And on. And the Oprah Network. This is so much better than watching TV like a muggle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay. Thank you. We’ll be in touch. You’re not gonna believe this.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What’s going on? Oh. Wait. On. And off. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That was NASA. They want me to go back up to the space station.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow. What did you tell them?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I told them I’d be honoured.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: A second trip to space, I’ll miss you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And I’m gonna miss you, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And I just want you to know, I’m happy to look in on Bernadette while you’re gone.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And if anything were to happen to you, we will name our first born son Howard. I’m just kidding. We’ll name him Dalib, after my grandfather.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, this one looks nice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. Sheldon doesn’t like reclaimed wood.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s afraid the original owners will come back.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, Sheldon’s not here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, he is here. So unless you want to dig him out with a bone saw and a melon baller, there’s nothing I can do about it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, sweetie, you’re paying for this table, and it’s your apartment, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know, but…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No buts. You got to stop letting him boss you around.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re right. I mean, he decides what TV shows we watch, what food we eat, who my favourite hobbit is. I wanted Frodo, but we can’t both have Frodo, so guess who’s stuck with Samwise Gamgee.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: See? Right there. You’re a grown man, you should be able to pick whichever hobbit you want. Wish you wouldn’t, but one problem at a time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You make a lot of sense. I like this table, and I’m getting it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? This one?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That one? Damn right I like that one.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good news. Someone in this room gets to take a ride on a rocket.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Fine. Can I at least shower first?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, not that. Although you already agreed to it, so no take-backs.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sit down. NASA called. The telescope mount I installed on the space station got damaged, and they want me to go back up and fix it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wow. Well, what did you say?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What do you think I said? I said yes. Why do you look surprised?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, it’s just, after last time, I didn’t think you’d ever want to go back.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Are you kidding? It was the greatest experience of my life.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really? ‘Cause I kind of remember a lot of complaining and wishing for it to be over.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I think you have me confused with what’s gonna happen when you get out of that shower.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, all set. What do you think? There’s plenty of room for everybody, a view out the window.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My spot on the couch has a great view of a window. Sometimes I can see space battles through it. It’s called a TV.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Give it a chance, Sheldon, you might actually like it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re absolutely right. Nope.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you can’t say he didn’t give it a fair shot.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, when can we get rid of it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re not.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What about the roommate agreement? It specifically states that any changes in furnishing have to be approved by the Furnishing Committee. Which only sits on alternate years. Yeah, and by the way, it sits over there.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, that is ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She’s right, a committee that important should meet more often.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s not what I’m saying.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. This is the thing about me standing up to him and not letting him run my life?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. I think we’ve found the problem here. It’s not the table at all. It’s you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, it’s always me, take one for the team.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have spent years turning this lump of clay into an acceptable conduit for my will, and then you came along and reshaped him, with your newfangled ideas and your fancy genitals.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you gonna let him talk to me like this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fancy sounds like a compliment.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I have not tried to change Leonard. That’s just what happens in relationships. Look how much Amy’s changed you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s not true.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, please. When I first met you, you were incapable of touching another human being. Now you’re holding hands, you’re going on dates, you even made out with her on a train.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She told you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course she told me, it’s the most interesting thing that’s ever happened to her in her entire life.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re too close to it, but Amy has had a huge impact on you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re right. Without realizing it, I’ve allowed that woman to alter my personality.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm, Sheldon, you didn’t have a personality, you just had some shows you liked.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. No, I’ve changed. Like the frog who’s put in a pot of water that’s heated so gradually he doesn’t realize he’s boiling to death.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Or you’re the frog who’s been kissed by a princess and turned into a prince.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Or you’re just a tall, annoying frog.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. I have to break up with my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Sheldon, wait.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. You’ve opened my eyes to the truth. Amy has made me a more affectionate, open-minded person. And that stops now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, we should call her.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, mm-hmm. Amy, it’s Penny. Hey. Just a little heads-up. Leonard bought a dining room table. Yeah. Sheldon’s breaking up with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy? Amy? Amy? I’ll get right to the point. I think we need to end this relationship, so just sign this with your finger, and, uh, please don’t cry on my iPad, I didn’t get AppleCare.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m not surprised you want to end the relationship. I’m a little surprised you didn’t get AppleCare. Anyway, enjoy your life. Where do I sign?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: At the bottom. I must say, I’m relieved you’re not making more of a scene out of this.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I’ve already moved on. Besides, this breakup has nothing to do with me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It doesn’t?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Of course not. This is just Leonard trying to take the focus off that dreadful table by sowing discord in our relationship. He’s manipulating you like he always does.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, wait, now, hang on. You think he manipulates me?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All the time. And he knew that, as your girlfriend, I wasn’t gonna stand by and let him bring a table into your apartment. I mean, a table? Come on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It is hideous.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, thankfully, I won’t have to see it, ’cause I won’t be your girlfriend anymore. Amy Farrah Fowler. Why, yes, I would like to take a survey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. You were really gonna stand by me against the dining room table?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Of course I was.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. How do I know that you’re not manipulating me right now?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think if I were manipulating you, you’d be smart enough to see it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How do I know you’re not saying that as part of the manipulation?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think you’d be smart enough to see that, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. I’m sorry I gave you such a hard time, I just had to be sure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s pretty exciting that NASA wants to send Howard back up.

utterance.speaker: Bermadette
utterance.content: Yeah, exciting. Can I ask you something?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Course.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He hated that entire experience. Does it make me an awful wife if I don’t think he should do it again?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not at all. He’s forgotten how miserable he was the entire time he was up there. It’s like me in those moments when I miss India.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So you’ll talk to him?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why me?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, I’m his wife, I don’t want to ruin it for him.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s the dynamic, I’m the fun one, you’re the buzzkill.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Since when am I the buzzkill?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you think this is cool?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, I think it’s stupid.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Aha.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re right, it’s great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey. You guys didn’t break up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Sorry to disappoint you, but Amy pointed out that you were only trying to manipulate me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Which you also figured out by yourself.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Which I also figured out by myself.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I’m glad you’re still together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, you can stop trying to make this about our relationship.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Which is stronger than ever.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Which is stronger than ever. This is about you trying to change my environment, which was perfect the way it was.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But it got the way it was through change. The-the-the spot that you love to sit in, that no one else can sit in, only exists because, despite your objections. I bought this couch. Me. So explain why that change was bad and this change was good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You don’t need to explain yourself to him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t need to explain myself to you!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re sick of his nonsense and ready to move in with me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Keep the table. We don’t use that space.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Damn it, I got cocky.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Bernie. I’m home. Hello.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hi, honey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Maybe you should have a seat.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Um, okay. I know my mom’s not dead, there’d be balloons.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Um, okay. First off, know that we all love you and cherish you.

utterance.speaker: Mike Rostenkowski
utterance.content: Well, I wouldn’t…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Daddy.

utterance.speaker: Mike R
utterance.content: You’re great.

utterance.speaker: Mike Massimino (on skype)
utterance.content: Can I say something?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, of course.

utterance.speaker: Mike M
utterance.content: Hey, Fruit Loops.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Massimino? Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: Mike M
utterance.content: Well, I heard you were thinking about going back up to the space station, and as someone who’s been there with you, well, you know how astronauts need to have the right stuff?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Mike M
utterance.content: The stuff you have is wrong.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You don’t think I did a good job up there?

utterance.speaker: Mike M
utterance.content: You did a fine job. It’s just, you were scared and miserable the whole time.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I think what we’re all trying to say is, you don’t seem to be remembering how traumatic the experience was for you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Like how women often forget the pain of childbirth.

utterance.speaker: Mike R
utterance.content: Like a woman. Great analogy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine, maybe I was a little scared.

utterance.speaker: Mike M
utterance.content: You peed in your space suit.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re supposed to do that.

utterance.speaker: Mike M
utterance.content: Not during the fitting.

utterance.speaker: Mike R
utterance.content: Son, do I need to remind you what you asked me to do before you went up last time?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on. That was just me joking around.

utterance.speaker: Mike R
utterance.content: You wanted me to shoot you in the foot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, how is that not a joke? You got to get me out of this. Shoot me in the foot.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t forget all the other astronauts picking on you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And how you threw up in zero gravity, and it floated back in your mouth. And you threw up again. And so on and so on.

utterance.speaker: Mike M
utterance.content: That was funny.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, so I wasn’t exactly John Glenn up there, but I’ve changed. I’m a different man now. Yeah, and I’m a little insulted that you guys don’t think I can handle it.

utterance.speaker: Mike M
utterance.content: You know you’re gonna have to go through survival training again.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’ve got to get me out of this.

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: What do you want me to do? You’re perfectly healthy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Check my blood pressure again. I can get it higher. just give me a second.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (on phone)
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hi, Ma. How are you?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: How I am is not dead, but you wouldn’t know that, because you don’t love me enough to pick up the phone.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Go, go, go.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: For all you know, I could have slipped in the tub and drowned. That’s what happened to your Aunt Ida.

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Howard, I’m so sorry your blood pressure was off the charts.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, me, too. I mean, the doctor was willing to fudge the results, but it just seemed so darned dishonest.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: But the mission wouldn’t be for at least a year. Isn’t that enough time to get your blood pressure under…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, my blood pressure’s too high, okay? Drop it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, my aunt changed her diet, and in a few months, she…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Went to space? I don’t think so. Now, pass the soy sauce. Hey, not the green one, the red one.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, Amy, will you please come join us?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s fun up here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So why are you trying to ruin it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, thanks. We’re fine. I mean, if you people want to eat at the table, then that’s what you should do. I like eating down here because this is how we’ve always done things. But if those days are gone, they’re gone. It just makes me sad.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Now I feel bad.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, don’t anthropomorphize him, he’s got big eyes, but his feelings are not like ours.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, it just seems silly for us to sit in two groups.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, it’s not silly if you think of that group as being led by a big, evil baby.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Look at Amy down there. Should we go?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: But Penny, this was your idea. You said that I should stand up to him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Forget it, Leonard. It’s over.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Rajesh?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Screw that! I sat on the floor for seven years. I’m staying right here.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come on, Raj, it’s not the same without you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Fine. But no more making fun of how I say tings.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You mean tings like moo-stache?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, isn’t this nice. Sometimes the baby wins.
